User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Many sites are getting around the popup blockers provided by browsers and other tools by using DHTML to create a block element that is made visible upon entering a page. These DHTML-based popups either look like windows in the centre of the screen, or else a band that sits across the entire bottom of the screen, or pop up when the mouse hovers over an element in the page (usually containing buttons to share a page on social networking sites).

These popups are just as annoying as the regular window popups.

It would be extremely useful for Firefox to address this new type of popup. I realise it will need a completely different approach to the existing popup blocker, but it would be a great improvement.

Reproducible: Always

comments.raw_text:
There must be a regex to Adblock this :)

Nice idea tho.

I'm not sure about the regex. The process used is different - the "popup" is actually a hidden HTML element loaded as part of the page, and then a javascript is used to set its visibility and position at runtime via CSS.
